District finances Courses you offer students Safety Special Education Gifted services District partnerships 2025-26 District Calendar School Finances Visit the WolfPack Hub: The One-Stop-Shop for West Clermont Families Facebook Instagram View this profile on Instagram West Clermont (@ West Clermont ) • Instagram photos and videos Ours is a story worth telling and a new chapter is unfolding. We are a district ON THE RISE and this is OUR story. Our students are academically prepared as we create experiences that thrill and delight them and prepare them to create the lives they desire. Together as ONE community, we learn, lead, and succeed. The View at Clermont National | Restaurants Outdoor Seating | The View at Clermont National, Diamond Club Drive, Clermont, FL 34711, USA top of page Food & Drinks Order Food Upcoming Events Tour Private Parties Map & Hours Events Promo Video More Use tab to navigate through the menu items. Food, Drinks and Fun! Food Marketplace & Bar with a View Welcome to The View at Clermont National where delicious food meets a vibrant bar scene with incredible views, outdoor seating and an InRange Driving Range. Enjoy our mouthwatering food options while you watch your favorite sports team on TV. Enjoy handcrafted cocktails, fine wines and local brews on tap. Families are welcomed, with kid-friendly activities, outdoor yard games and live music on the weekends. Come experience The View at Clermont National. Food and Drinks! Order Food Signature Drinks Menus Host Your Event with Us Looking for a unique venue for your next event? Look no further than The View at Clermont National. Our beautiful event space boasts spectacular views, and our team is dedicated to making your event unforgettable. Contact us today to learn more. Private Parties Stop by the Top Tracer Driving Range for some fun! Enjoy a mixture of games and virtual golf courses from all over the world. Visit CN Golf Location & Hours Monday - Thurs: 11am-10pm Friday: 11am-11pm Saturday: 10am-11pm Sunday: 10am-10pm Join Our Mailing List Subscribe Now Thanks for submitting! organization in the United States. Secure .gov websites use HTTPS A lock ( Lock Locked padlock icon ) or https:// means you've safely connected to
the .gov website. Share sensitive information only on official,
secure websites. Private Parties | The View top of page Food & Drinks Order Food Upcoming Events Tour Private Parties Map & Hours Events Promo Video More Use tab to navigate through the menu items. Private Parties / Corporate Events Host your next private party or corporate event at the View! Let our catering and bar services compliment your vision for the perfect party. From outdoor grill get-togethers on the driving range patio to celebrations in our sunroom or elegant evenings of dancing under the stars, the only limit is your imagination. ​ Whether your party is for 20 or several 100, we'll make your event one to remember! MULTIPLE EVENT SPACES We have 7 areas on our property that can be rented for your private event. An elegant dinner on the patio, casual lunch at The Range, the options are truly endless. Sunroom Marketplace Dobel Lounge Overlook Patio Courtyard The Range Patio 30 Bay Driving Range EVENTS OF ALL KINDS Team building, company holiday parties, presentations over lunch, bridal showers, birthday parties and everything in between. Please complete the brief interest form below and our dedicated team will reach out to you to help start planning your amazing event! Monday - Thurs: 11am-10pm Friday: 11am-11pm Saturday: 10am-11pm Sunday: 10am-10pm Join Our Mailing List Subscribe Now Thanks for submitting! 5 Waterfront Dining Spots in Clermont, Florida top of page Food & Drinks Order Food Upcoming Events Tour Private Parties Map & Hours Events Promo Video More Use tab to navigate through the menu items. All Posts Search 5 Waterfront Dining Spots in Clermont, Florida kelsey1261 May 15, 2024 2 min read Bask in the scenic beauty of Clermont, Florida, where dining by the water elevates every meal into a picturesque event. Whether you're seeking a romantic setting, a family-friendly atmosphere, or simply a serene spot to relax, Clermont's waterfront restaurants cater to all. Explore our top 5 picks for the best waterfront dining experiences, including the standout, "The View at Clermont National." 1. The View at Clermont National Experience dining like never before at "The View at Clermont National," where every meal is accompanied by stunning views of Lake Minneola. Our menu features locally-sourced ingredients and seasonal specialties that promise to delight. Perfect for a sunset dinner or a chic brunch. Water View Dining at it's best! 2.  Lilly’s on the Lake Located directly on Lake Minneola, Lilly’s on the Lake offers Caribbean-flavored meals and a vibrant atmosphere. With live music and an expansive outdoor seating area, it’s a perfect spot for a fun evening out. 3. Lake Minneola Tiki Bar & Grill Situated on the edge of Lake Minneola, this Tiki Bar & Grill provides not just great food and drinks but also a front row seat to water sports and sunset views. 4. The Crooked Spoon Gastropub While not directly on the waterfront, The Crooked Spoon offers a rooftop that provides lovely views of the surrounding area, including glimpses of water in the distance. It's a great spot for gourmet burgers and craft beers. 5. Salt Shack on the Lake Located on Lake Minneola off Highway 50 in Historic Downtown Clermont, Salt Shack on the Lake offers a breathtaking oasis with Island vibes, wild-caught seafood, delicious drinks, and fun for the whole family. Clermont's dining scene offers a mix of flavors and settings for every occasion, all enhanced by the beautiful backdrop of Florida’s lakes. Whether you're local or visiting, these spots ensure a memorable dining experience with spectacular water views. Monday - Thurs: 11am-10pm Friday: 11am-11pm Saturday: 10am-11pm Sunday: 10am-10pm Join Our Mailing List Subscribe Now Thanks for submitting! Home - Clermont Trust About Us Our Team Bespoke Solutions Clermont Conscience Careers FAQ News Contact Search Menu WE PROVIDE BESPOKE WEALTH, TAX AND SUCCESSION PLANNING SOLUTIONS VIA MULTI-JURISDICTIONAL CORPORATE AND TRUST STRUCTURES. PURSUING EXCELLENCE PURSUING EXCELLENCE Founded in 1996, we are an independent, owner-managed business. Through our relationship-focused approach we provide bespoke fiduciary and family office services to private clients, families and institutions across the globe. PROACTIVE & ENTREPRENEURIAL About Us WE OFFER BESPOKE WEALTH PROTECTION TO FAMILIES, INVESTORS AND ENTREPRENEURS Founded in 1996, we are an independent, owner-managed business free from private equity or bank ownership. Our team has grown to over 120 largely professionally qualified staff members across our offices in Geneva, London, Guernsey, the British Virgin Islands, Mauritius, Cyprus and the US. Our staff comprises over 20 different nationalities, with fluency in more than 12 languages, ensuring our local technical knowledge is complemented by cultural understanding, perspective and access. Notwithstanding that we are in multiple locations we function as a single organisation, collaborating daily across our offices so that our clients benefit from the best of our diverse team’s skill and experience wherever they, or we, may be OUR APPROACH Relationship-focused Through our relationship-focused approach, we strive to fulfil the wishes, aspirations and goals of our clients with a view to developing meaningful relationships across each generation Bespoke We provide tailor-made fiduciary and family office services aimed at proactively resolving the complexities associated with successfully managing cross border, multi-generational wealth and transactional activity Independent Our independence ensures that we remain client-centric and avoid conflicts of interest at all times Our Team View More OUR SERVICES Bespoke Solutions We advise private clients, family offices and corporate bodies in designing and establishing bespoke multi-jurisdictional structures and provide comprehensive administrative services for the life of those structures Our services form an integral part of our clients’ complex financial arrangements, offering continuity and consistency over multiple generations Establishing Structures – Trusts – Private Trust Companies (PTCs) – Corporate vehicles and transaction SPVs – Foundations – Limited Partnerships – Syndicated investment vehicles – Group and regional holding companies – Trading companies Advisory – Cross-border wealth, tax and succession planning – Analysing, advising on and structuring commercial transactions Administration – Full trusteeship services – Providing company board and foundation council members – Company secretarial services – Corporate governance implementation – Administering, monitoring and maintaining multi-jurisdictional assets – Coordination of external advisers and asset managers Accounting – Real time bookkeeping and financial reporting – Preparation of annual financial statements – Bespoke financial reporting – Granular consolidated reporting – Tax and VAT returns Regulatory and Compliance – FATCA registration and annual submissions – CRS categorisation and annual submissions – Economic Substance evaluation and compliance – Responding to legal, fiscal and regulatory developments WE ARE DELIGHTED TO PRESENT Learn More NEWS Knowledge & Understanding 26 Jul Interview CLERMONT INSIGHTS – ROW: Tammy Spencer and Tina Sanborn BACK ROW: Ryan Patton, Jim Rudy, and Michael Chumley Mission of the Board of Education The Board of Education is legally responsible for: Developing policies and regulations necessary for the governance of the school district, its employees, students, and all persons entering school grounds or premises Ensuring students are provided with high-quality educational opportunities Appointing a superintendent of schools and investing such powers in him/her as may be legally delegated Appointing a treasurer Acting on personnel and policies recommended by the superintendent Seeing that the annual budget is prepared and acted on Passing an annual appropriations measure Adopting a master calendar annually Entering into contracts with all personnel in the manner required by Ohio laws Levying taxes with a vote of the people to maintain schools We encourage all of those living and/or working in our school district to take an interest in the work of the Board of Education. We invite you to join us at our meetings or to call or email us with any ideas, questions or concerns. Board Aspirational Goals West Clermont School District is recognized nationally as an exemplary, innovative, cost-effective model school district. A destination district for students seeking success and educators seeking innovation. The West Clermont School District is recognized as a model district, one where families choose to educate their children. The district is known for its innovation and creativity, student-centered learning model, educator workforce, modern learning environments, and family and community partnerships. The district has an exemplary return on investment. Student achievement for all students is growing, award-winning, and nationally competitive. High academic achievement and growth occur for all students. Students learn to become responsible and productive leaders in their community. Students achieve regional, state, and national recognition for all aspects of their talents. Community and family engagement is strong and results in mutual pride and support. The business community is highly engaged in the district’s work. Proactive communications foster transparency and active involvement. The community is proud of their school district. The community is welcome in district facilities and programs. The community recognizes the district's cost-effectiveness and invests accordingly. Students are provided with the very best educational experiences. Our district exhibits a high-performance culture. All students at all grade levels receive rich learning experiences. Students have clear pathways to success beginning in early grades and continuing through life. Present circumstances are not an excuse for poor performance. Student learning goes beyond the classroom and beyond the basics. Talent is attracted and retained in a collaborative and unifying environment. The district attracts and retains high-quality faculty and staff. Faculty and staff talent flourishes through purposeful growth opportunities. The faculty and staff work in a professionally rewarding environment that engages their heart and mind. Members of the Board of Education Ryan Patton Board President Ryan was elected to the West Clermont board in 2021. He is a Deputy Sheriff with Clermont County and previously served as a School Resource Officer at West Clermont. This allowed him to proactively engage with students and staff. His goals as a board member include adopting policies that focus on the priorities of the district; developing initiatives that improve student achievement; and ensuring fiscal responsibility. Jim Rudy Board Vice-President Jim has been a West Clermont board member since January 2018. As a former teacher and union leader in the district, he has an intimate knowledge of the school culture. Giving back to the community, particularly the students, is what motivates him. Since serving on the board, he is most proud of hiring excellent leaders who are fulfilling West Clermont’s mission to commit to excellence with every learner, every day, every way. Michael Chumley Board Member Michael is in his fifth year as a West Clermont board member. He works for a local healthcare system where he has learned the importance of timely and accurate communication, a skill that transfers well to his role with the district. The students, including his own, are what motivate him to serve. He is committed to helping children overcome the academic and social-emotional trials of the last two years. His favorite part about being on the board is witnessing how the entire West Clermont team cares for one another and the students, which is evidenced by the many recognitions and awards staff receive each year. Tina Sanborn Board Member Tina was originally elected to the West Clermont School Board in 2011 and served until 2019. One of her goals as a board member is to promote academic excellence for all students. Tina wants to align taxpayer dollars with an educational system that gives our children the opportunities to excel in an ever more competitive economic environment. She served on the board during the opening of a new facility for West Clermont High School, West Clermont Middle School, Summerside Elementary and Willowville Elementary. Her passion is serving the West Clermont School District Board of Education and working to improve and provide the best educational opportunities for every student. Tammy Spencer Board Member Tammy was elected to the West Clermont board in 2023.  She has been a member of the West Clermont community for nearly 40 years, and has served as an educator for the past 15 years.  As a mom, grandmother, resident and educator, she is poised to bring a unique and meaningful perspective to the board. She is committed to timely and transparent communication, fiscal responsibility and efficient operations, while continuing to support a district on the rise.
